org.scec.psha.imr
Interface IMRTesterAPI

All Superinterfaces:
IntensityMeasureRelationshipAPI, NamedObjectAPI
public interface IMRTesterAPI
extends IntensityMeasureRelationshipAPI, NamedObjectAPI

Title: IMRTesterAPI
Description: All IMR Testers must implement this so that they can be plugged automatically into the IMRTesterApplet Copyright: Copyright (c) 2001
Company:

See Also:
IMRTesterApplet

NUM

public static final int NUM
Number of points to calculate between x-axis min and x-axis max, i.e. the constraint range of the choosen x-axis independent variable

ROCK_PGA_PERIOD

public static final java.lang.String ROCK_PGA_PERIOD
The default period for the coefficients needed to calculate the rockPGA variable
Method Detail

getInitialInvisibleParamNames

public java.util.Vector getInitialInvisibleParamNames()
Used by the GUI to make certain independent parameters invisible depending on what is initially choosen for the IMT type, X-Axis and Y-Axis. For instance, if the Magnatude is choosen for the X-Axis, it should not appear as an editable parameter, the constraints are used to calculate it's values
Returns:
The initialInvisibleParamNames value

getParameterListenerFullClassName

public java.lang.String getParameterListenerFullClassName()
Used to create the parameter listener at runtime dynamically from this string
Returns:
The parameterListenerFullClassName value

getIndependentParameterList

public ParameterList getIndependentParameterList()
Used by the gui to get the list of independent parameters that are editable
Returns:
The independentParameterList value

Used by the GUI to get the component parameter

The controlParameterList value

public ParameterAPI getSelectedIMTParameter()
Used by the GUI to get the selected Intensity Measure Type
Returns:
The selectedIMTParameter value

getSelectedIMTNameAndValue

public java.lang.String getSelectedIMTNameAndValue()
Used by the GUI to get the selected Intensity Measure Type name and value string
Returns:
The selectedIMTNameAndValue value

setSelectedIMTParameter

public void setSelectedIMTParameter(java.lang.String nameAndValue)
                             throws ParameterException
This function assumes that both the name and value of a IMT parameter are given in the passed in string, seperated by a /. For example "SA/0.0". The name and value has to be parsed from this string. THis string is retrieve from the GUI in a picklist.
Parameters:
nameAndValue - The new selectedIMTParameter value
Throws:
ParameterException - Description of the Exception

getIMTYAxisLabel

public java.lang.String getIMTYAxisLabel()
Builds the Y-Axis Name, which may include units, and includes the IM Type choosen, either "SA" or "PGM". Solely used for labeling the graph
Returns:
The iMTYAxisLabel value

getXAxisLabel

public java.lang.String getXAxisLabel()
Returns which X-Axis were choosen, appending the units if present in the parameter. Used for Plot labeling of the x-axis.
Returns:
The xAxisLabel value

getXYAxisTitle

public java.lang.String getXYAxisTitle()
                                throws ConstraintException
Builds a Plot title string of the form "y-axis label vs. x-axis label". The x and y axis labels are obtained by calling getXAxisLabel() and getIMTYAxisLabel()
Returns:
The xYAxisTitle value
Throws:
ConstraintException - Description of the Exception

getChoosenFunction

public XYDiscretizedFunction2DAPI getChoosenFunction()
                                              throws ConstraintException
Controller function. Dispacter function. Based on which Y-Axis was choosen, determines which dependent variable discretized function to return. Once the discretized function has been calculated (by other functions), the x-axis and y-axis name is set in the Discretized function, and the independent parameters that were used in the model calculation are set in the function.
Returns:
The choosenFunction value
Throws:
ConstraintException - Description of the Exception

getStdDevForXAxis

public XYDiscretizedFunction2DAPI getStdDevForXAxis()
                                             throws ConstraintException
Function needs to be fixed because point may not go to the end, i.e. max because of math errors with delta = (max - min)/num. Value choosen from the controlsParameterList presented in the GUI
Returns:
The stdDevForXAxis value
Throws:
ConstraintException - Description of the Exception

getMeansForXAxis

public XYDiscretizedFunction2DAPI getMeansForXAxis()
                                            throws ConstraintException
Function needs to be fixed because point may not go to the end, i.e. max because of math errors with delta = (max - min)/num. Value choosen from the controlsParameterList presented in the GUI
Returns:
The meansForXAxis value
Throws:
ConstraintException - Description of the Exception

getExceedProbForXAxis

public XYDiscretizedFunction2DAPI getExceedProbForXAxis()
This function determines which X-Axis parameter was choosen, then calls getExceedProbForXAxis(ParameterAPI xAxisParam), returning it's results. maybe a better way to do this, repeat a couple of functions.
Returns:
The exceedProbForXAxis value
